title: RDS Session desktop shortcut
author: TomAltenburg
body_snippet:
I was sent here from the Subreddit.

It would be nice to have the ability to open a RDS session straight from your desktop, instead of having to open mRemoteNG first and scrolling through the connections tab.

Thanks in advance.

iterations.description: Feature request for command-line switch to open a specific connection directly, enabling desktop shortcuts to RDS sessions - has community support and clear implementation path

comments.author: kmscode
comments.snippet:
Reference: https://www.reddit.com/r/mRemoteNG/comments/5gzt28/shortcut/

> The only way that I can think of to implement this would be to add a command line switch to open a specific connection. With a command line switch, a shortcut could be made to open that specific connection.

comments.author: neverw1nter
comments.snippet: Upping this since this feature would truly make things much easier.

notes:
AI triage: Feature request for command-line switch to open a specific connection directly, enabling desktop shortcuts to RDS sessions - has community support and clear implementation path
Approach: Add a --connect <connection-name-or-id> command-line argument that, on startup, locates the matching connection in the tree and automatically opens it, allowing users to create Windows shortcuts with this parameter
